result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy L. Hogan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy L. Hogan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy L. Hogan was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: from DA schiek not objecting to removal of "obtain HSED" from condition of probation - amendment/order drafted by PO previously signed by PFO

03:04 pm - Defendant Jeremy L. Hogan in court with attorney Richard J. Shawl.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf108, 13cf67 (DPA), 14cm126, 14cm188, 14fo476, 14tr1355.  In case 14cf108 - State moves to amend Count 1 to Misdemeanor Theft - 943.20(1)(a) and dismiss Count 2 - Granted.  In 13cf67 - Counts 2 and 3 will be rescinded and defendant will be found guilty.  In case 14cm126 - State moves to dismiss count 2 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1.  In 14cm188 - State moves to dismiss - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to 14fo476 - Court finds guilty.  Fine $452.50.  In case 14tr1355 - Defendant pleads no contest.  Court finds guilty.  Fine $389.50.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Schiek/Shawl/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.  
Court Sentence - Concurrent
WHS/POP 2 yrs 6 months
Court Costs/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Psychological assessment and follow through
Obtain GED
Obtain/maintain full time employment/student status
AODA assessment and recovery
Jail credit 13cf67 - 2 days credit
Probation to collect fines assessed in 14tr1355 and 14fo476 as courtesy
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
